required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Multi-Year Study of Fluzone High-Dose Influenza Vaccine Compared With Fluzone® Vaccine in Adults Aged 65 Years and Older
clinical_study.official_title: Multi-Year Efficacy Study of Fluzone High-Dose Trivalent Vaccine Compared With Fluzone® Vaccine In Adults ≥ 65 Years of Age

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this study is to determine the efficacy of Fluzone High Dose vaccine and that of Fluzone® vaccine in the elderly.
Primary objective:
To measure the efficacy of the vaccine, defined as the prevention of laboratory-confirmed influenza caused by viral types/subtypes that are antigenically similar to those contained in the respective annual vaccine formulations.
Secondary objectives:
- To compare the clinical efficacy of Fluzone High Dose vaccine with that of Fluzone® vaccine in elderly adults, with respect to laboratory-confirmed influenza illness caused by any type or subtype of influenza virus.
- To compare the clinical efficacy of Fluzone High Dose vaccine with that of Fluzone® vaccine in elderly adults, in preventing culture-confirmed influenza illness caused by viral types/subtypes antigenically similar to those contained in the respective annual vaccine formulations.

detailed_description.textblock:
The occurrence of influenza-like illness (ILI) will be determined in elderly participants vaccinated with either Fluzone High Dose or Fluzone® vaccine.
The presence of influenza virus in the respiratory tract of vaccinated individuals with ILI will be confirmed by two methods.

clinical_study.why_stopped: No safety concerns, study terminated due to lack of primary endpoint cases in 2009-2010 Flu season (coincided with H1N1 Pandemic) Subjects followed per-protocol

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of Fluzone High Dose Relative to Fluzone in the Prevention of Laboratory Confirmed Influenza Caused by Viral Types and Subtypes That Are Antigenically Similar to Those Contained in the Respective Annual Vaccine Formulations.
primary_outcome.description: The presence (and specific identification) of influenza virus in the respiratory tract of vaccinated individuals with influenza like illness (ILI) was confirmed by tissue culture (for infectious virus) and molecular techniques (polymerase chain reaction based assays), with results reported for cases cause by any viral type or subtype.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Reporting Events Associated With All Cases of Protocol Defined Influenza-Like Illness (ILI)
other_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 (pre-vaccination) up to the end of the influenza season
other_outcome.description: Events associated with Protocol defined influenza-like Illnesses (ILI) were defined as pneumonia, new onset or exacerbation of pre-existing cardio respiratory conditions, health care visits, and medication use (including nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs, NSAIDs).

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Reporting Events Associated With All Cases of CDC Defined Influenza-Like Illness (ILI)
other_outcome.description: Events associated with CDC defined influenza-like Illnesses (ILI) were defined as pneumonia, new onset or exacerbation of pre existing cardio respiratory conditions, health care visits, and medication use (including nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs, NSAIDs).

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Reporting Adverse Events of Special Interest (AESIs) and Serious Adverse Events Post-vaccination With Either Fluzone High-Dose and Fluzone
other_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 before vaccination to Day 180 after vaccination
other_outcome.description: Adverse events of special interest: new onset of Guillain Barre Syndrome (GBS), Bell's Palsy, encephalitis or myelitis, optic neuritis, Stevens Johnson Syndrome, and toxic epidermal necrolysis

intervention.intervention_name: Trivalent inactivated influenza vaccine High Dose

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria :
- Aged ≥ 65 years on the day of vaccination
- Informed consent form signed and dated.
- Able to attend all scheduled visits and to comply with all trial procedures.
Exclusion Criteria :
- Participation in another interventional clinical trial investigating a vaccine, drug, medical device, herbal supplement, or a medical procedure in the 4 weeks preceding the trial vaccination or planned participation in another clinical trial investigating a vaccine, drug, medical device, herbal supplement, or a medical procedure during each year of participation in the study trial.
- Vaccination against influenza in the 6 months preceding the trial vaccination.
- Systemic hypersensitivity to eggs, chicken proteins, or any of the vaccine components, or a history of a life-threatening reaction to Fluzone vaccine or to a vaccine containing any of the same substances.
- Personal history of Guillain-Barré syndrome.
- Dementia or any other cognitive condition at a stage that could interfere with following the trial procedures.
- Thrombocytopenia, bleeding disorder, or anticoagulation therapy contraindicating intramuscular (IM) vaccination.
- Known or suspected human immunodeficiency virus (HIV), Hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg), or Hepatitis C seropositivity.
- Alcohol abuse or drug addiction that could interfere with the subject's ability to comply with trial procedures.
- Subject deprived of freedom by an administrative or court order, or in an emergency setting, or hospitalized without his/her consent.
- Bedridden subjects.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were enrolled in the study from 22 September 2009 to 07 November 2009 at 99 clinical centers in the US.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 9158 of the 9172 participants that were randomized were vaccinated, evaluated, and reported in this report.

group.title: Fluzone® High Dose
group.description: All participants received a single dose of Fluzone High Dose vaccine on Day 0.

group.title: Fluzone®
group.description: All subjects received a single dose of Fluzone vaccine on Day 0.

group.title: Fluzone® High Dose
group.description: All participants received a single dose of Fluzone High Dose vaccine on Day 0.

group.title: Fluzone®
group.description: All subjects received a single dose of Fluzone vaccine on Day 0.

outcome.title: Efficacy of Fluzone High Dose Relative to Fluzone in the Prevention of Laboratory Confirmed Influenza Caused by Viral Types and Subtypes That Are Antigenically Similar to Those Contained in the Respective Annual Vaccine Formulations.
outcome.description: The presence (and specific identification) of influenza virus in the respiratory tract of vaccinated individuals with influenza like illness (ILI) was confirmed by tissue culture (for infectious virus) and molecular techniques (polymerase chain reaction based assays), with results reported for cases cause by any viral type or subtype.
outcome.population: Efficacy was assessed in all participants who met all study inclusion criteria and none of the exclusion criteria, received the vaccine to which they were randomized, and had no protocol violations that might have interfered with evaluation of primary endpoints (Per Protocol Analysis Set).

measure.description: The presence (and specific identification) of influenza virus in the respiratory tract of vaccinated individuals with influenza like illness (ILI) was confirmed by tissue culture (for infectious virus) and molecular techniques (polymerase chain reaction based assays), with results reported for cases cause by any viral type or subtype.
measure.population: Efficacy was assessed in all participants who met all study inclusion criteria and none of the exclusion criteria, received the vaccine to which they were randomized, and had no protocol violations that might have interfered with evaluation of primary endpoints (Per Protocol Analysis Set).

outcome.title: Number of Participants Reporting Events Associated With All Cases of Protocol Defined Influenza-Like Illness (ILI)
outcome.description: Events associated with Protocol defined influenza-like Illnesses (ILI) were defined as pneumonia, new onset or exacerbation of pre-existing cardio respiratory conditions, health care visits, and medication use (including nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs, NSAIDs).
outcome.time_frame: Day 0 (pre-vaccination) up to the end of the influenza season
outcome.population: The occurrence of events associated with ILI was assessed in all participants who met all study inclusion and exclusion criteria, received the vaccine to which they were randomized, and had no protocol violations that might have interfered with evaluation of primary endpoints (Per-Protocol Analysis Set).

class.title: New Onset or Exacerbation of Cardio Respiratory

outcome.title: Number of Participants Reporting Adverse Events of Special Interest (AESIs) and Serious Adverse Events Post-vaccination With Either Fluzone High-Dose and Fluzone
outcome.description: Adverse events of special interest: new onset of Guillain Barre Syndrome (GBS), Bell's Palsy, encephalitis or myelitis, optic neuritis, Stevens Johnson Syndrome, and toxic epidermal necrolysis
outcome.time_frame: Day 0 before vaccination to Day 180 after vaccination
outcome.population: Adverse events of special interest were assessed in all participants who received study vaccine (Full Analysis Set).

Lung squamous cell carcinoma stage unspecified

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Sponsor must have the opportunity to review at least 60 days prior to submission for publication or presentation. If review indicates that potentially patentable subject matter would be disclosed, publication or public disclosure may be delayed for a maximum of an additional 60 days to allow for filing the necessary patent applications

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The study was terminated due to lack of primary endpoint cases in 2009-2010 influenza season (coincided with the H1N1 Pandemic). There were no safety concerns; enrolled subjects were followed per-protocol.
